page.title: 06HISTORICAL NAMES OF RAMSGATE
page.content: Many of the local street and place-name reflect local history.Nethercourt Estate is built on the site of the old Nether Court Farm and House;Southwood Gardens is where Southwood House once stood;Ellington Road leads to the park where Ellington House stood until 100 years ago.Grange Road starts at the Grange and Abbey built by Pugin.Royalty is well represented by Regency Hotel, King Street,Queen Street and the Royal Harbour,named after the visits of King George IV in 1821.The harbour and town were taking shape at the time of the Napoleonic Wars.Military Road,Nelson Crescent,Wellington Crescent,La Belle Alliance Square,they all show the towns connections with that period.Near to the school are Chilton farmhouse dating from the Queen Anne period,and Pegwell village which was famous for its shrimps,fishing and smugglers!
